trans-unit.source: Step 5: Connect Bridge and Services
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Connect Bridge and Services

trans-unit.source: The previous topics in the tutorial demonstrated how to create the two relay services and how to configure the <token>request_response</token>.
trans-unit.target: The previous topics in the tutorial demonstrated how to create the two relay services and how to configure the <token>request_response</token>.

trans-unit.source: This topic demonstrates how to connect the <token>bridge</token> to the two services so that the message that comes to the <token>bridge</token> is routed to the right relay service.
trans-unit.target: This topic demonstrates how to connect the <token>bridge</token> to the two services so that the message that comes to the <token>bridge</token> is routed to the right relay service.

trans-unit.source: And then finally, according to the <link xlink:href="14d7f8b8-074c-485f-a2f6-c9a02cc1779a#BKMK_Scenario" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business Scenario</link>, this tutorial demonstrates how to stamp the messages routed to the relay services with the <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel> message header.
trans-unit.target: And then finally, according to the <link xlink:href="14d7f8b8-074c-485f-a2f6-c9a02cc1779a#BKMK_Scenario" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business Scenario</link>, this tutorial demonstrates how to stamp the messages routed to the relay services with the <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel> message header.

trans-unit.source: To achieve these goals, perform the following three tasks:
trans-unit.target: To achieve these goals, perform the following three tasks:

trans-unit.source: Add the two-way relay endpoint components to the itinerary designer to represent the two-way relay services that receive the message from the <token>bridge</token>.
trans-unit.target: Add the two-way relay endpoint components to the itinerary designer to represent the two-way relay services that receive the message from the <token>bridge</token>.

trans-unit.source: Connect the <token>bridge</token> to the two-way relay endpoints on the <token>bridge</token> and set the routing condition.
trans-unit.target: Connect the <token>bridge</token> to the two-way relay endpoints on the <token>bridge</token> and set the routing condition.

trans-unit.source: Stamp the messages sent to the relay services with the <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel> message header.
trans-unit.target: Stamp the messages sent to the relay services with the <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel> message header.

trans-unit.source: Represent Relay Services in the BizTalk Service Project
trans-unit.target: Represent Relay Services in the BizTalk Service Project

trans-unit.source: As mentioned earlier, the tutorial already has two relay receiver services defined and one <token>request_response</token> configured to process the messages.
trans-unit.target: As mentioned earlier, the tutorial already has two relay receiver services defined and one <token>request_response</token> configured to process the messages.

trans-unit.source: While the <token>bridge</token> is part of the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, the relay receiver services are two separate projects in themselves.
trans-unit.target: While the <token>bridge</token> is part of the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, the relay receiver services are two separate projects in themselves.

trans-unit.source: The <token>bridge</token> and the relay receiver services must be connected together so that the messages processed by the <token>bridge</token> can be routed to the services, and vice versa, the response from the relay services can be routed back to the <token>bridge</token> and then to the client.
trans-unit.target: The <token>bridge</token> and the relay receiver services must be connected together so that the messages processed by the <token>bridge</token> can be routed to the services, and vice versa, the response from the relay services can be routed back to the <token>bridge</token> and then to the client.

trans-unit.source: To enable this scenario, the <token>msgflow</token> design surface provides a <embeddedLabel>Two-Way Relay Endpoint</embeddedLabel> component that you can include in the <token>msgflow_proj</token> to represent two-way relay services, <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: To enable this scenario, the <token>msgflow</token> design surface provides a <embeddedLabel>Two-Way Relay Endpoint</embeddedLabel> component that you can include in the <token>msgflow_proj</token> to represent two-way relay services, <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel> and <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: To represent RelayReceiverServiceA in the project
trans-unit.target: To represent RelayReceiverServiceA in the project

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>Two-Way Relay Endpoint</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>Two-Way Relay Endpoint</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface.

trans-unit.source: When you drop the component on the itinerary designer, it adds a configuration file to the project.
trans-unit.target: When you drop the component on the itinerary designer, it adds a configuration file to the project.

trans-unit.source: This configuration file must be updated to provide information about the endpoint for the relay service.
trans-unit.target: This configuration file must be updated to provide information about the endpoint for the relay service.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to update the configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to update the configuration file.

trans-unit.source: From the Solution Explorer, right-click the .config file for the <embeddedLabel>Two-Way Relay Endpoint</embeddedLabel> component and then select <embeddedLabel>Edit WCF Configuration</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Service Configuration Editor</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: From the Solution Explorer, right-click the .config file for the <embeddedLabel>Two-Way Relay Endpoint</embeddedLabel> component and then select <embeddedLabel>Edit WCF Configuration</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Service Configuration Editor</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Expand the <embeddedLabel>Endpoints</embeddedLabel> node under the <embeddedLabel>Client</embeddedLabel> node in the tree view pane, and then select the existing endpoint <embeddedLabel>TwoWayRelayServiceReference1</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Expand the <embeddedLabel>Endpoints</embeddedLabel> node under the <embeddedLabel>Client</embeddedLabel> node in the tree view pane, and then select the existing endpoint <embeddedLabel>TwoWayRelayServiceReference1</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Client Endpoint</embeddedLabel> details pane, in the <embeddedLabel>General</embeddedLabel> tab, enter the following properties.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Client Endpoint</embeddedLabel> details pane, in the <embeddedLabel>General</embeddedLabel> tab, enter the following properties.

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Enter the endpoint name, for example, <userInput>RelayService_SmallAmounts</userInput>, to represent the relay receiver service that will process messages with quotation amount less than $10000.
trans-unit.target: Enter the endpoint name, for example, <userInput>RelayService_SmallAmounts</userInput>, to represent the relay receiver service that will process messages with quotation amount less than $10000.

trans-unit.source: Whatever value you enter here, enter the same value for the <embeddedLabel>Endpoint Configuration Name</embeddedLabel> property.
trans-unit.target: Whatever value you enter here, enter the same value for the <embeddedLabel>Endpoint Configuration Name</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: Address
trans-unit.target: Address

trans-unit.source: The complete address where the relay endpoint is hosted on the <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: The complete address where the relay endpoint is hosted on the <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, set the address to the URL where the <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel> is hosted.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, set the address to the URL where the <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel> is hosted.

trans-unit.source: You can get the address from the command prompt that represents the RelayReceiverServiceA.
trans-unit.target: You can get the address from the command prompt that represents the RelayReceiverServiceA.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the address should be <codeInline>https://%%amp;lt;your_servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;.servicebus.windows.net/RelayReceiverServiceA</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Typically, the address should be <codeInline>https://%%amp;lt;your_servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;.servicebus.windows.net/RelayReceiverServiceA</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: In the Service Configuration Editor, from the Tree View pane, expand <embeddedLabel>Advanced</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>Endpoint Behaviors</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>New Endpoint Behavior Configuration</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the Service Configuration Editor, from the Tree View pane, expand <embeddedLabel>Advanced</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>Endpoint Behaviors</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>New Endpoint Behavior Configuration</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Behavior</embeddedLabel> details pane, enter a name for the behavior, for example, <userInput>ServiceCredentialBehavior</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Behavior</embeddedLabel> details pane, enter a name for the behavior, for example, <userInput>ServiceCredentialBehavior</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Behavior element extension position</embeddedLabel> area, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, from the <embeddedLabel>Available Elements</embeddedLabel> box, select <userInput>transportClientEndpointBehavior</userInput>, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> again.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Behavior element extension position</embeddedLabel> area, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, from the <embeddedLabel>Available Elements</embeddedLabel> box, select <userInput>transportClientEndpointBehavior</userInput>, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> again.

trans-unit.source: You must add this element to enter the <token>sb2</token> credentials for a particular endpoint.
trans-unit.target: You must add this element to enter the <token>sb2</token> credentials for a particular endpoint.

trans-unit.source: In the Tree View pane, go back to the service endpoint (<embeddedLabel>RelayService_SmallAmounts</embeddedLabel>) that you created, and select the newly created endpoint behavior configuration from the <embeddedLabel>BehaviorConfiguration</embeddedLabel> drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: In the Tree View pane, go back to the service endpoint (<embeddedLabel>RelayService_SmallAmounts</embeddedLabel>) that you created, and select the newly created endpoint behavior configuration from the <embeddedLabel>BehaviorConfiguration</embeddedLabel> drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Accept the default values for all the other properties and from the <embeddedLabel>File</embeddedLabel> menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Accept the default values for all the other properties and from the <embeddedLabel>File</embeddedLabel> menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Close the dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Close the dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Open the config file (available under the <embeddedLabel>MessageFlowItinerary.bcs</embeddedLabel> in the Solution Explorer) in an XML editor.
trans-unit.target: Open the config file (available under the <embeddedLabel>MessageFlowItinerary.bcs</embeddedLabel> in the Solution Explorer) in an XML editor.

trans-unit.source: You will notice that the following has been added to the service configuration file:
trans-unit.target: You will notice that the following has been added to the service configuration file:

trans-unit.source: For a <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint, you only need to include the token credentials.
trans-unit.target: For a <token>sb2</token> relay endpoint, you only need to include the token credentials.

trans-unit.source: So, you must remove the <embeddedLabel>clientCredentials</embeddedLabel> element and add the value for the <token>sb2</token> Issuer Name and Issuer Secret for the <embeddedLabel>tokenProvider</embeddedLabel> credentials.
trans-unit.target: So, you must remove the <embeddedLabel>clientCredentials</embeddedLabel> element and add the value for the <token>sb2</token> Issuer Name and Issuer Secret for the <embeddedLabel>tokenProvider</embeddedLabel> credentials.

trans-unit.source: The section of the configuration file would now resemble the following:
trans-unit.target: The section of the configuration file would now resemble the following:

trans-unit.source: Save changes and close the configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Save changes and close the configuration file.

trans-unit.source: On the <token>msgflow</token> design surface, right-click the component, and then select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: On the <token>msgflow</token> design surface, right-click the component, and then select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following table provides information about the properties:
trans-unit.target: The following table provides information about the properties:

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Associated Project Item
trans-unit.target: Associated Project Item

trans-unit.source: A read-only field that provides the name of the associated .config file.
trans-unit.target: A read-only field that provides the name of the associated .config file.

trans-unit.source: If you change the name of the component on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface by changing the <embeddedLabel>Entity Name</embeddedLabel> property, the name of the .config also changes.
trans-unit.target: If you change the name of the component on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface by changing the <embeddedLabel>Entity Name</embeddedLabel> property, the name of the .config also changes.

trans-unit.source: Endpoint Configuration Name
trans-unit.target: Endpoint Configuration Name

trans-unit.source: Name of the client endpoint configuration in the .config file that defines the address, the binding, and the contract for the WCF relay service that you are representing on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface.
trans-unit.target: Name of the client endpoint configuration in the .config file that defines the address, the binding, and the contract for the WCF relay service that you are representing on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, set this property to <userInput>RelayService_SmallAmounts</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, set this property to <userInput>RelayService_SmallAmounts</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: You specified the same value for the <embeddedLabel>Name</embeddedLabel> property in the previous step.
trans-unit.target: You specified the same value for the <embeddedLabel>Name</embeddedLabel> property in the previous step.

trans-unit.source: Because the service configuration file can have any number of endpoints defined, the endpoint name you enter for this property is matched with the endpoint configuration name in the .config file.
trans-unit.target: Because the service configuration file can have any number of endpoints defined, the endpoint name you enter for this property is matched with the endpoint configuration name in the .config file.

trans-unit.source: When a match happens, the corresponding address, binding, and contract for that endpoint are considered.
trans-unit.target: When a match happens, the corresponding address, binding, and contract for that endpoint are considered.

trans-unit.source: Entity Name
trans-unit.target: Entity Name

trans-unit.source: The name of the relay endpoint component on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface.
trans-unit.target: The name of the relay endpoint component on the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface.

trans-unit.source: This name must be unique for an <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: This name must be unique for an <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, name it <userInput>SmallAmounts_Service</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, name it <userInput>SmallAmounts_Service</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Runtime Address
trans-unit.target: Runtime Address

trans-unit.source: The public runtime endpoint URL where the relay service is deployed.
trans-unit.target: The public runtime endpoint URL where the relay service is deployed.

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: To represent RelayReceiverServiceB in the project
trans-unit.target: To represent RelayReceiverServiceB in the project

trans-unit.source: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>Two-Way Relay Endpoint</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface.
trans-unit.target: From the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>, drag and drop the <embeddedLabel>Two-Way Relay Endpoint</embeddedLabel> component to the <token>msgflow_proj</token> design surface.

trans-unit.source: When you drop the component on the design surface, it adds a configuration file to the project.
trans-unit.target: When you drop the component on the design surface, it adds a configuration file to the project.

trans-unit.source: This configuration file must be updated to provide information about the endpoint for the relay service.
trans-unit.target: This configuration file must be updated to provide information about the endpoint for the relay service.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to update the configuration file.
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to update the configuration file.

trans-unit.source: From the Solution Explorer, right-click the .config file for the <embeddedLabel>Two-Way Relay Endpoint</embeddedLabel> component and then select <embeddedLabel>Edit WCF Configuration</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Service Configuration Editor</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: From the Solution Explorer, right-click the .config file for the <embeddedLabel>Two-Way Relay Endpoint</embeddedLabel> component and then select <embeddedLabel>Edit WCF Configuration</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Service Configuration Editor</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Expand the <embeddedLabel>Endpoints</embeddedLabel> node under the <embeddedLabel>Client</embeddedLabel> node in the tree view pane, and then select the existing endpoint <embeddedLabel>TwoWayRelayServiceReference1</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Expand the <embeddedLabel>Endpoints</embeddedLabel> node under the <embeddedLabel>Client</embeddedLabel> node in the tree view pane, and then select the existing endpoint <embeddedLabel>TwoWayRelayServiceReference1</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Client Endpoint</embeddedLabel> details pane, in the <embeddedLabel>General</embeddedLabel> tab, enter the following properties.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Client Endpoint</embeddedLabel> details pane, in the <embeddedLabel>General</embeddedLabel> tab, enter the following properties.

trans-unit.source: Property Name
trans-unit.target: Property Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Enter the endpoint name, for example, <userInput>RelayService_LargeAmounts</userInput>, to represent the relay receiver service that will process messages with quotation amount greater than $10000.
trans-unit.target: Enter the endpoint name, for example, <userInput>RelayService_LargeAmounts</userInput>, to represent the relay receiver service that will process messages with quotation amount greater than $10000.

trans-unit.source: Whatever value you enter here, enter the same value for the <embeddedLabel>Endpoint Configuration Name</embeddedLabel> property.

trans-unit.source: Address
trans-unit.target: Address

trans-unit.source: The complete address where the relay endpoint is hosted on the <token>sb2</token>.
trans-unit.target: The complete address where the relay endpoint is hosted on the <token>sb2</token>.

trans-unit.source: For this tutorial, set the address to the URL where the <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel> is hosted.
trans-unit.target: For this tutorial, set the address to the URL where the <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel> is hosted.

trans-unit.source: You can get the address from the command prompt that represents the RelayReceiverServiceB.

trans-unit.source: Typically, the address should be <codeInline>https://%%amp;lt;your_servicebus_namespace%%amp;gt;.servicebus.windows.net/RelayReceiverServiceB</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: In the Service Configuration Editor, from the Tree View pane, expand <embeddedLabel>Advanced</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>Endpoint Behaviors</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>New Endpoint Behavior Configuration</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the Service Configuration Editor, from the Tree View pane, expand <embeddedLabel>Advanced</embeddedLabel>, right-click <embeddedLabel>Endpoint Behaviors</embeddedLabel>, and then select <embeddedLabel>New Endpoint Behavior Configuration</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Behavior</embeddedLabel> details pane, enter a name for the behavior, for example, <userInput>ServiceCredentialBehaviorB</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Behavior</embeddedLabel> details pane, enter a name for the behavior, for example, <userInput>ServiceCredentialBehaviorB</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Behavior element extension position</embeddedLabel> area, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel>, from the <embeddedLabel>Available Elements</embeddedLabel> box, select <userInput>transportClientEndpointBehavior</userInput>, and then select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> again.

trans-unit.source: You must add this element to enter the <token>sb2</token> credentials for a particular endpoint.
trans-unit.target: You must add this element to enter the <token>sb2</token> credentials for a particular endpoint.

trans-unit.source: In the Tree View pane, go back to the service endpoint (<embeddedLabel>RelayService_LargeAmounts</embeddedLabel>) that you created, and select the newly created endpoint behavior configuration from the <embeddedLabel>BehaviorConfiguration</embeddedLabel> drop-down list.
trans-unit.target: In the Tree View pane, go back to the service endpoint (<embeddedLabel>RelayService_LargeAmounts</embeddedLabel>) that you created, and select the newly created endpoint behavior configuration from the <embeddedLabel>BehaviorConfiguration</embeddedLabel> drop-down list.

trans-unit.source: Accept the default values for all the other properties and from the <embeddedLabel>File</embeddedLabel> menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Accept the default values for all the other properties and from the <embeddedLabel>File</embeddedLabel> menu, select <embeddedLabel>Save</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: Connect the <token>bridge</token> with Relay Services
trans-unit.target: Connect the <token>bridge</token> with Relay Services

trans-unit.source: This section provides instructions on how to connect the <token>bridge</token> with the two relay services.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instructions on how to connect the <token>bridge</token> with the two relay services.

trans-unit.source: As part of the Connectors, enter the route conditions that govern when a message is routed to <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel> and when its routed to <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: As part of the Connectors, enter the route conditions that govern when a message is routed to <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceA</embeddedLabel> and when its routed to <embeddedLabel>RelayReceiverServiceB</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The following procedure provides instructions on how to connect the <token>bridge</token> with the two services and how to set the routing conditions.
trans-unit.target: The following procedure provides instructions on how to connect the <token>bridge</token> with the two services and how to set the routing conditions.

trans-unit.source: To connect <token>bridge</token> with relay services
trans-unit.target: To connect <token>bridge</token> with relay services

trans-unit.source: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, select the <embeddedLabel>Connector</embeddedLabel> component under the <embeddedLabel><token>bridge</token>s</embeddedLabel> category in the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: In the <token>msgflow_proj</token>, select the <embeddedLabel>Connector</embeddedLabel> component under the <embeddedLabel><token>bridge</token>s</embeddedLabel> category in the <embeddedLabel>Toolbox</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Take the mouse pointer to the right-end of the <token>bridge</token> (denoted by a red dot when you move the cursor over the component).
trans-unit.target: Take the mouse pointer to the right-end of the <token>bridge</token> (denoted by a red dot when you move the cursor over the component).

trans-unit.source: The mouse pointer changes to show a small <embeddedLabel>S</embeddedLabel> sign denoting that this component is the source for the Connector.
trans-unit.target: The mouse pointer changes to show a small <embeddedLabel>S</embeddedLabel> sign denoting that this component is the source for the Connector.

trans-unit.source: Select and hold the mouse at the dot, drag it to the left end of the target component, <embeddedLabel>SmallAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel> relay endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Select and hold the mouse at the dot, drag it to the left end of the target component, <embeddedLabel>SmallAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel> relay endpoint.

trans-unit.source: The cursor changes again to show a small <embeddedLabel>T</embeddedLabel> denoting the target; release the mouse.
trans-unit.target: The cursor changes again to show a small <embeddedLabel>T</embeddedLabel> denoting the target; release the mouse.

trans-unit.source: The two components are now connected.
trans-unit.target: The two components are now connected.

trans-unit.source: Repeat this step to connect the <token>bridge</token> to the other relay service endpoint, <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Repeat this step to connect the <token>bridge</token> to the other relay service endpoint, <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Set the routing conditions on the two Connectors.
trans-unit.target: Set the routing conditions on the two Connectors.

trans-unit.source: The routing condition must be set on the quote amount in the request message that the <token>bridge</token> receives.
trans-unit.target: The routing condition must be set on the quote amount in the request message that the <token>bridge</token> receives.

trans-unit.source: The procedure, <link xlink:href="a4bf9e02-cac7-4bc8-b842-735294a240b8#BKMK_ReqP_Enrich" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To extract and promote properties in the pre-transform Enrich stage</link>, already configures the <token>bridge</token> to extract the value of the quote amount into a property called <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The procedure, <link xlink:href="a4bf9e02-cac7-4bc8-b842-735294a240b8#BKMK_ReqP_Enrich" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">To extract and promote properties in the pre-transform Enrich stage</link>, already configures the <token>bridge</token> to extract the value of the quote amount into a property called <embeddedLabel>QuoteAmount</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: Here, you use that property to define the routing condition.
trans-unit.target: Here, you use that property to define the routing condition.

trans-unit.source: Right-click the route Connector between <token>request_response</token> and <embeddedLabel>SmallAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel> relay endpoint, and then select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the route Connector between <token>request_response</token> and <embeddedLabel>SmallAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel> relay endpoint, and then select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane, for the <embeddedLabel>Filter Condition</embeddedLabel> property, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> button to the open the <embeddedLabel>Route Filter Configuration</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel> pane, for the <embeddedLabel>Filter Condition</embeddedLabel> property, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> button to the open the <embeddedLabel>Route Filter Configuration</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the dialog box, select the <embeddedLabel>Filter</embeddedLabel> option, and then enter the following filter string:
trans-unit.target: In the dialog box, select the <embeddedLabel>Filter</embeddedLabel> option, and then enter the following filter string:

trans-unit.source: Use standard SQL 92 syntax for filter expressions.
trans-unit.target: Use standard SQL 92 syntax for filter expressions.

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> to save the changes and exit.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> to save the changes and exit.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the previous step for the Connector between <token>request_response</token> and <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel> relay endpoint and enter the filter string as:
trans-unit.target: Repeat the previous step for the Connector between <token>request_response</token> and <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel> relay endpoint and enter the filter string as:

trans-unit.source: The <token>msgflow</token> design surface resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: The <token>msgflow</token> design surface resembles the following:

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.

trans-unit.source: With these changes to the project, messages that are sent to the <token>bridge</token> are appropriately routed to the right relay service based on the quote amount.
trans-unit.target: With these changes to the project, messages that are sent to the <token>bridge</token> are appropriately routed to the right relay service based on the quote amount.

trans-unit.source: Include Custom Headers in the Message
trans-unit.target: Include Custom Headers in the Message

trans-unit.source: The other requirement of the <link xlink:href="14d7f8b8-074c-485f-a2f6-c9a02cc1779a#BKMK_Scenario" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business Scenario</link> as part of the routing configurations is to ensure that the messages sent to the relay services are stamped with a header called <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: The other requirement of the <link xlink:href="14d7f8b8-074c-485f-a2f6-c9a02cc1779a#BKMK_Scenario" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Business Scenario</link> as part of the routing configurations is to ensure that the messages sent to the relay services are stamped with a header called <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: The value of the <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel> header must be set to <embeddedLabel>SmallAmounts</embeddedLabel> (if the message is routed to the relay endpoint <embeddedLabel>SmallAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel>) or <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts</embeddedLabel> (if the message is routed to the relay endpoint <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel>).
trans-unit.target: The value of the <embeddedLabel>QuoteType</embeddedLabel> header must be set to <embeddedLabel>SmallAmounts</embeddedLabel> (if the message is routed to the relay endpoint <embeddedLabel>SmallAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel>) or <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts</embeddedLabel> (if the message is routed to the relay endpoint <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel>).

trans-unit.source: To add custom headers to the message
trans-unit.target: To add custom headers to the message

trans-unit.source: Right-click the route Connector between the <token>bridge</token> and the <embeddedLabel>SmallAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel> relay endpoint, and then select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click the route Connector between the <token>bridge</token> and the <embeddedLabel>SmallAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel> relay endpoint, and then select <embeddedLabel>Properties</embeddedLabel>.

trans-unit.source: In the Properties pane, for the <embeddedLabel>Route Action</embeddedLabel> property, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> button to the open the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In the Properties pane, for the <embeddedLabel>Route Action</embeddedLabel> property, select the ellipsis <embeddedLabel>()</embeddedLabel> button to the open the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Route Actions</embeddedLabel> dialog box, select <embeddedLabel>Add</embeddedLabel> to open the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: In the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:
trans-unit.target: In the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box, do the following:

trans-unit.source: Section
trans-unit.target: Section

trans-unit.source: Field name
trans-unit.target: Field name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Property (Read From)
trans-unit.target: Property (Read From)

trans-unit.source: Expression
trans-unit.target: Expression

trans-unit.source: Set this property to <userInput>'SmallAmounts'</userInput>, which is the value of the message header we are adding.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to <userInput>'SmallAmounts'</userInput>, which is the value of the message header we are adding.

trans-unit.source: Always enter the value for an expression within single quotes.
trans-unit.target: Always enter the value for an expression within single quotes.

trans-unit.source: Destination (Write To)
trans-unit.target: Destination (Write To)

trans-unit.source: Type
trans-unit.target: Type

trans-unit.source: Set this property to <userInput>SOAP</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to <userInput>SOAP</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: SOAP Header Namespace
trans-unit.target: SOAP Header Namespace

trans-unit.source: Set this property to <codeInline>http://Northwind.com/insurance/ACORD1/xml/</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to <codeInline>http://Northwind.com/insurance/ACORD1/xml/</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: The value you enter is the namespace of the message header.
trans-unit.target: The value you enter is the namespace of the message header.

trans-unit.source: Identifier
trans-unit.target: Identifier

trans-unit.source: Set this property to <userInput>QuoteType</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: Set this property to <userInput>QuoteType</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: The value you enter is the name of the message header.
trans-unit.target: The value you enter is the name of the message header.

trans-unit.source: The dialog box resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: The dialog box resembles the following:

trans-unit.source: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> again in the <embeddedLabel>Route Connections</embeddedLabel> dialog box.
trans-unit.target: Select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> in the <embeddedLabel>Add Route Action</embeddedLabel> dialog box and then select <embeddedLabel>OK</embeddedLabel> again in the <embeddedLabel>Route Connections</embeddedLabel> dialog box.

trans-unit.source: Repeat the last step on the route Connector between the <token>bridge</token> and the <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel> relay endpoint.
trans-unit.target: Repeat the last step on the route Connector between the <token>bridge</token> and the <embeddedLabel>LargeAmounts_Service</embeddedLabel> relay endpoint.

trans-unit.source: However, for that Connector you must enter the value in the <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel> field as <userInput>'LargeAmounts'</userInput>
trans-unit.target: However, for that Connector you must enter the value in the <embeddedLabel>Expression</embeddedLabel> field as <userInput>'LargeAmounts'</userInput>

trans-unit.source: Save changes to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
trans-unit.target: Save changes to the <token>msgflow_proj</token>.
